termsAndConditions.summary:
A 16-25 Railcard gives you 1/3 off rail fares across Britain. Your discount covers the following fares and more: 

- Standard Anytime, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak  
- Standard and First Class Advance  
- Anytime Day Travelcard Zones 1-9 when bought as part of ticket to London from outside London (min fare £19.10) 
- Gatwick Express, Stansted Express and Heathrow Express 

You can travel anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week, but a minimum fare of £12 applies to all journeys made before 10:00 Monday to Friday.

fareType.name: Advance Single
fareType.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on the date, time and trains specified. You may not start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station except to change to/from connecting trains as shown on the ticket(s) or other valid travel itinerary.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Tickets must be purchased in advance of travel, subject to availability.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: No refunds available.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: Yes - date/time of tickets can be changed up until time of departure (or 18:00 the day before travel if you have chosen to print your own ticket(s)) subject to the payment up to GBP 10.00 fee per ticket per person and any difference in fares. If you change to a train on which a cheaper fare is available, the difference will not be refunded. Not possible to change the origin or destination.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Child discounts, 16-25 Railcard, Family and Friends Railcard (standard class only), Senior Railcard, Two Together Railcard, HM Forces and Disabled Persons Railcards discounts apply.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: BTS

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

fareType.name: Off-Peak Single
fareType.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: Your  journey must be on off-peak trains on the date specified. Off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: Break of journey is generally permitted unless prohibited for the journey that you are making. If you intend to break your journey, please contact us to check if it is permitted. You can always break your journey where necessary to change train.

conditions.title: ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS
conditions.description: Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: SVS

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

fareType.name: Super Off-Peak Day Return
fareType.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on super off-peak trains on the date specified. Super off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows super off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your outward and/or return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.

conditions.title: OTHER CONDITIONS
conditions.description: The outward portion of a Super Off-Peak Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: PDR

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

conditions.description: You must travel on super off-peak trains on the date specified. Super off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows super off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your outward and/or return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.

conditions.title: OTHER CONDITIONS
conditions.description: The outward portion of a Super Off-Peak Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: PDR

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

- Standard Anytime, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak  
- Standard and First Class Advance  
- Anytime Day Travelcard Zones 1-9 when bought as part of ticket to London from outside London (min fare £19.10)

fareType.name: Advance Single
fareType.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on the date, time and trains specified. You may not start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station except to change to/from connecting trains as shown on the ticket(s) or other valid travel itinerary.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Tickets must be purchased in advance of travel, subject to availability.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: No refunds available.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: Yes - date/time of tickets can be changed up until time of departure subject to the payment up to GBP 10.00 fee per ticket per person and any difference in fares. If you change to a train on which a cheaper fare is available, the difference will not be refunded. Not possible to change the origin or destination.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Child discounts, 16-25 Railcard, Family and Friends Railcard (standard class only), Senior Railcard, Two Together Railcard, HM Forces and Disabled Persons Railcards discounts apply.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: V2Q

conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: Break of journey is generally permitted unless prohibited for the journey that you are making. If you intend to break your journey, please contact us to check if it is permitted. You can always break your journey where necessary to change train.

conditions.title: ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS
conditions.description: Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: CDS

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

termsAndConditions.summary:
A 16-25 Railcard gives you 1/3 off rail fares across Britain. Your discount covers the following fares and more: 

- Standard Anytime, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak  
- Standard and First Class Advance  
- Anytime Day Travelcard Zones 1-9 when bought as part of ticket to London from outside London (min fare £19.10) 
- Gatwick Express, Stansted Express and Heathrow Express 

You can travel anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week, but a minimum fare of £12 applies to all journeys made before 10:00 Monday to Friday.

fareType.name: Off-Peak Day Return
fareType.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on off-peak trains on the date specified. Off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your outward and/or return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.

conditions.title: OTHER CONDITIONS
conditions.description: The outward portion of an Off-Peak Day Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.

conditions.title: ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS
conditions.description: Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: CDR

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

fareType.name: Advance Single
fareType.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on the date, time and trains specified. You may not start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station except to change to/from connecting trains as shown on the ticket(s) or other valid travel itinerary.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Tickets must be purchased in advance of travel, subject to availability.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: No refunds available.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: Yes - date/time of tickets can be changed up until time of departure subject to the payment up to GBP 10.00 fee per ticket per person and any difference in fares. If you change to a train on which a cheaper fare is available, the difference will not be refunded. Not possible to change the origin or destination.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Child discounts, 16-25 Railcard, Family and Friends Railcard (standard class only), Senior Railcard, Two Together Railcard, HM Forces and Disabled Persons Railcards discounts apply.

conditions.description: V2S

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Non-refundable ticket, only valid for the date, time and trains specified.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on the date, time and trains specified. You may not start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station except to change to/from connecting trains as shown on the ticket(s) or other valid travel itinerary.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Tickets must be purchased in advance of travel, subject to availability.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: No refunds available.

fareType.name: Off-Peak Day Return
fareType.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION
conditions.description: Flexible ticket only valid at specific off-peak times of the day.

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on off-peak trains on the date specified. Off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used. An admin fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

conditions.title: AMENDING YOUR BOOKING
conditions.description: You can change the time of your outward and/or return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.

conditions.title: OTHER CONDITIONS
conditions.description: The outward portion of an Off-Peak Day Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.

conditions.title: ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS
conditions.description: Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: CDN

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

conditions.description: You can change the time of your outward and/or return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.

conditions.title: DISCOUNTS
conditions.description: Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.

conditions.title: BREAK OF JOURNEY
conditions.description: You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.

conditions.title: OTHER CONDITIONS
conditions.description: The outward portion of an Off-Peak Day Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.

conditions.title: ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS
conditions.description: Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.

conditions.title: CODE
conditions.description: CDN

conditions.title: ACCESSIBILITY
conditions.description: View information about wheelchair spaces and accessibility on board your train here www.nationalrail.co.uk/on-the-train/accessible-train-travel-and-facilities. Find out how to book travel assistance here www.nationalrail.co.uk/help-and-assistance/passenger-assist.

termsAndConditions.summary:
A 16-25 Railcard gives you 1/3 off rail fares across Britain. Your discount covers the following fares and more: 

- Standard Anytime, Off-Peak and Super Off-Peak  
- Standard and First Class Advance  
- Anytime Day Travelcard Zones 1-9 when bought as part of ticket to London from outside London (min fare £19.10) 
- Gatwick Express, Stansted Express and Heathrow Express 

You can travel anytime on weekends, public holidays and during the week, but a minimum fare of £12 applies to all journeys made before 10:00 Monday to Friday.

conditions.title: DESCRIPTION

conditions.title: VALIDITY
conditions.description: You must travel on off-peak trains on the date specified. Off-peak times vary by route - our journey planner only shows off-peak tickets on trains for which they are valid.

conditions.title: BOOKING
conditions.description: Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

conditions.title: REFUNDS
conditions.description: If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used.
